results.title: LARP = Live action role playing
results.brief_description: Mini doco about the game of live action role playing. Includes revealing interviews with several individuals about their character(s) and their role(s) in the game and why LARP plays such an important part in their life.

results.title: Larger than life
results.brief_description: Two iconic Australian films. Two iconic Australian costumes.

constellations_primary.name: Dance sequins
constellations_primary.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

results.description:
While most of the Oscar-winning costumes in The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert (1994) were made with small budgets and creative solutions like crafting glamorous outfits from cheap flip-flops, the pom-poms on this iconic wattle dress worn by Felicia JollyGoodFellow (Guy Pearce) were made by inmates at the Long Bay Correctional Complex.

In Baz Luhrmann’s Strictly Ballroom (1992), another Australian classic released two years earlier, sparkles are a must. Despite Australian Dancing Federation President Barry Fife’s (Bill Hunter) limited time on the dance floor, his sequined tuxedo shimmers and shines and helps bring what production and costume designer Catherine Martin calls the film’s “marvellous preposterousness” to life.
description_for_label:
While most of the Oscar-winning costumes in The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert (1994) were made with small budgets and creative solutions like crafting glamorous outfits from cheap flip-flops, the pom-poms on this iconic wattle dress worn by Felicia JollyGoodFellow (Guy Pearce) were made by inmates at the Long Bay Correctional Complex.

In Baz Luhrmann’s Strictly Ballroom (1992), another Australian classic released two years earlier, sparkles are a must. Despite Australian Dancing Federation President Barry Fife’s (Bill Hunter) limited time on the dance floor, his sequined tuxedo shimmers and shines and helps bring what production and costume designer Catherine Martin calls the film’s “marvellous preposterousness” to life.

results.title: Large green zoetrope with metal base
results.brief_description: Animation device called Zoetrope and assorted animation strips. Body of Zoetrope is a cylinder formation closed on bottom and open at top with a series of slits around top rim and painted green. Wood spindle joins cylinder to metal tiered stand. Zoetrope has five various themed printed paper animation strips depicting illustrations of a sequence of drawings showing motion. Animation strips are either black and white or mono coloured with an animation on both sides.

results.title: Lara Croft: tomb raider (Special collector's edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Simon West, Colin Wilson, Lloyd Levin, Lawrence Gordon, Mutual Film Company and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: From the video game “Tomb raider” comes the first live action film, featuring heroine (and internet icon) Lara Croft. Lady Croft is an aristocrat who enjoys breaking the rules and shocking her peers by subverting her femininity. She is astute, athletic, a talented sharpshooter, an authority on archaeology and a dextrous woman who misses her daddy. Lara discovers an ancient clock that (when combined with its missing pieces) is able to control time. It is up to Lara to destroy the clock and prevent its power from falling to the Illuminati - a secret society that aims to harness this mystic force perpetuated by a rare planetary alignment that occurs every 5000 years. The film is a modern mix of digital effects and live action sequences filmed at various exotic locations including Cambodia and Iceland. Jolie certainly looks the part with her large bosom and lithe physique, but her performance is decidedly clunky and heavy handed. Paying a huge debt to Indiana Jones, “Lara Croft” is steeped in a faux mysticism (intriguing given that most characters are either killing, maiming or at the very least destroying ancient tombs) but despite its flaws still manages to achieve a certain level of escapist fun.

results.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
results.headline_credit: Cambodia and United States of America, 2001
results.brief_description: Angelina Jolie stars as the iconic videogame character Lara Croft in this early 2000s adaptation.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

results.description: English aristocrat Lara Croft is skilled in hand-to-hand combat and in the middle of a battle with a secret society. The fierce archaeologist moonlights as a tomb raider to recover lost antiquities and meets her match in the evil Powell, who’s in search of a powerful relic.

results.title: Laputa castle in the sky = Tenkuu no Shiro Rapyuta
results.creator_credit: Hayao Miyazaki, Tatsumi Yamashita, Isao Takahata and Studio Ghibli
results.brief_description: Children’s themed anime about a young girl fleeing pirates and corrupted government officials, who pursue her for a magical necklace that she wears. Pazu is the young boy who catches Sheeta as she floats down from the sky, and accompanies her on perilous adventures. Both seek Laputa, Sheeta’s ancestral home and a place of boyhood dreaming for Pazu, an elaborate and alluring Hayao airborne castle. Containing the visual spectacular feast that was the hallmark of “Spirited away”, Miyazaki presents an exciting adventure film, fleshing out his preoccupation with feisty (and imperilled) children, aeronautics and otherworldliness.
